findings.title: Revisited Logic in TokenManager::signalSetGov()
findings.description: The `TokenManager` contract's `signalSetGov()` function implicitly assumes the current governance as an active signer, which may not always hold.

findings.title: BnGMX Reduction Minimization with JIT StakedGMX Inflation
findings.description: The current implementation of unstaking logic in `_unstakeGmx()` routine can be improved to prevent manipulation of `multiplier points` and potential inflation.

findings.title: Possible Sandwich/MEV Attacks For Reduced Returns
findings.description: The `Treasury` contract's liquidity-adding logic may be subject to possible manipulation.

findings.title: Accommodation of Non-ERC20-Compliant Tokens
findings.description: The finding highlights the issue of accommodating non-ERC20-compliant tokens, specifically mentioning the `transfer` function and related idiosyncrasies from current widely-used token contracts, using USDT as an example.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the `BeamEx` protocol, there is a privileged `admin` account that plays a critical role in governing and regulating the system- wide operations. It also has the privilege to control or govern the flow of assets managed by this protocol.

findings.title: Incorrect Position Execution in PositionRouter
findings.description: The `_collectFees()` function in `PositionRouter` contract is incorrectly provided with `msg.sender` as the position owner instead of `request.account`, affecting routines `executeIncreasePosition()` and `_createIncreaseOrder()`.

findings.title: BLP CooldownDuration Bypass in Liquidity Removal
findings.description: The cooldown duration enforcement can be bypassed by transferring the BLP to another new account and instructing the new account to perform the liquidity removal.
